HTML the hypertext markup language

What is hypertext?

When the internet was a brand new it was used to publish research papers. It was like ordinary text (like in notepad), but also contained links to other documents (hyperlinks). So this new internet text was called hypertext, and is transfered via http (hypertext transfere protocol). Since its inception in the 1960's hypertext has come a long way. Not only may it create links to documents, it can include other media such as images, videos, sound, stylesheets, etc. It is the basis of the markup language, html.

What is markup?

Markup are tags which markup documents with formatting anotations. The tags themselves are not seen directly by the end viewer but are used to format text enclosed by the tags when the document is rendered (turned into a picture).
See Markup language on wikipedia.

What are html tags?

Modern html is a specific extension of xml, the extensible markup language.
Html, like xml, use three types of tags:
<tagname>
</tagname>
<tagname/>

Opening & Closing Tags

Every open tag needs a closing tag with a matching tag name. The opening tag has no slash, where as the closing tag starts with one.
<t1></t1>
Opening/closing tags can have more tags (elements) nested inside them. But they must be closed in the same order that they are openned.

Given the following:
<t1><t1></t1><t1></t1></t1>

The pairing is as follows:
<t1> <t1> </t1> <t1> </t1> </t1>

And the grouping is as follows:
<t1><t1></t1><t1></t1></t1>

Single Tags

Single tags are opening/closing tags combined into one:
<tagname></tagname> -> <tagname/>

What is an html document file?

An html document file typically is a text file ending in .html, and is written in html, as described above. Html documents also have a minimum, basic structure, as follows.

Minimal HTML 5 Document
<html>
<head>
</head>
 <body>
</body>
 </html>
As you can see, there is an html tag which encloses everything. It is the document itself. It then contains two sections, the head and the body. The head is not visible but contains meta data, external links, styles and scripts. The body is everything visible. All the text, images, paragraphs and divs are contained in the body.

Head Element
<head>
<title>Document Title</title>
 <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="icon.png"/>

<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style.css"/>
 <script type="text/javascript" src="script.js"></script>
 </head>
Body Element
<body>
<h1>Article Title</h1>
 <h2>First Section Title</h2>
 <p>This is the first paragraph in the article.</p>
 <h2>Second Section Title</h2>
 <p>This is the second paragraph in the article.</p>
 <br/> <img src="articleImage.png"/> <hr/> <ul>
<li>1st Item</p>
 </p>
 </p>
 </body>
